title: Unai Emery has pop at Arsene Wenger while defending Arsenal record
text:

Unai Emery had a pop at Arsene Wenger's reign while defending his own Arsenal record, saying the Gunners were not "competitive" under his predecessor.

Emery has faced criticism of his time so far as Arsenal boss, with Monday's 1-0 defeat to Sheffield United prompting pundit Jamie Carragher to blast: "I don’t see anything different from when Arsene Wenger was there at the end."

Arsenal have impressed in the Europa League, and on Thursday they host Portuguese side Vitoria Guimaraes looking to make three wins from three in the competition.

They reached the final last season but lost to Chelsea , meaning they missed out on Champions League football having finished only fifth in the Premier League in Emery's first campaign in charge.

It was the third season in a row that the Gunners had not finished in the top four, with Wenger having failed to achieve Champions League qualification in his final two campaigns.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

However, Emery has pointed out that Arsenal finished only one point off the Champions League places last term.

And while Wenger's Arsenal were the main challengers to Sir Alex Ferguson's Manchester United during the late 1990s and early 2000s, Emery pointed to a lack of competitiveness in Wenger's later years and said he is working on improving that.

"Sometimes we forget the memory and we need to remember," he said in quotes reported by the Evening Standard .

"When I arrived here, this team needed to improve being more competitive.

(Image: PA)

“This team in the history was winning 1-0 and being very competitive, but it wasn’t enough. Then one process being competitive and with improved creativity.

“When I arrived here, the creativity is more or less good, but being competitive was worse. It was not enough.

“I think last year I started to improve being competitive, also more or less creativity with some very good matches playing with that creativity.

“The supporters, there are a lot of supporters with different opinions. Some want more creativity, some want maybe more intensity, more energy. I want both and my way is both, both sometimes one player is less with than that another because this is the way.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

“Last year we did not achieve, we were in the table by one point and in the Europa League final and we lost in the end. And okay, we were there. And this year - be there and take it.”

Emery urged his critics to give him time as he looks to blood youngsters such as Joe Willock, Bukayo Sako and Gabriel Martinelli into the team.

He said: “We are playing for our supporters and my message is that we are going to carry on with patience, and tomorrow they will feel this team is playing as we want and also transmitting energy and playing good.

“My idea is being competitive, creativity and getting here. We are in one process with some young players - patience!”
description: Boss says Gunners had lost their competitive edge towards the end of his predecessor's reign and insists he is building for the future
